data.title: Piano Lessons, Tiamoyo Arts and Education Cleveland, OH Tiamoyo Music Academy
data.text:
WELCOME TO

TIAMOYO MUSIC ACADEMY

Serving the Chagrin Valley

Sharon Brown Cheston, Ph.D., Licensed Music Educator

Woodmere Village, OH

216-896-9651

mailing address:

Tiamoyo Arts and Education

Post Office Box 32

Chagrin Falls, OH 44022-0032

CONVENIENT DAYTIME CLASSES FOR

PRE-SCHOOLERS AND HOME-SCHOOLERS

Tiamoyo Music Academy is a place where students of all ages can enjoy music. Located in a peaceful, country-like setting, in the village of Woodmere, Ohio, Tiamoyo Music Academy is under the direction of Dr. Sharon Brown Cheston, educator, pianist, singer, ethnomusicologist, composer, author, conductor, wife, and mother.

"I really try to meet each student where he or she is in order to provide individualized, appropriate music instruction that coincides with the student's learning style. I believe each student has a unique musical voice that awaits an opportunity for expression. I value each student as a person, not just as a piano student and for their musical accomplishments."

Sharon Brown Cheston, Ph.D., Owner and Director

MUSIC TIME

Suzuki-based

Early Childhood Music Program

MUSIC TIME FOR INFANTS (birth-18 months)

MUSIC TIME FOR TODDLERS (18 months-3 1/2 years)

SUZUKI KIDZ FOR PRE-SCHOOLERS (3-5 years)

SUZUKI PIANO PROGRAM (4 years & older or instructor's approval)

Music Time, a Suzuki-based music program established on the philosophies and concepts of Dr. Shinichi Suzuki, is an exciting, eclectic, fun music curriculum that features developmentally appropriate activities for children to enjoy and explore music. Infants and toddlers, along with their caregivers, will explore rhythmic finger plays, musical nursury rhymes, songs, musical dramatization, literature, and movement. Students will use their voices, musical instruments, a variety of toys and props, and listening skills to explore various musical elements and things about themselves and our world. Children will play rhythmic games and explore movement, such as those used in Suzuki instrumental programs and in Dalcroze eurhythmics. In addition, the music learning approaches of Dr. Shinichi Suzuki, Dr. Edwin Gordon, Emile Jacques Dalcroze, Zoltan Kodaly, Carl Orff, and others will be used. For more information on the aforementioned music learning approaches, please click on the links below.

Suzuki Kidz, is a fun, pre-school Suzuki instrument study preparatory program that, while extending the Music Time curriculum, introduces Suzuki concepts, including learning melodies of the repertoire in Suzuki Piano School and Suzuki Violin School, Volume 1, singing, listening, movement, drama, pre-notation Suzuki theory concepts, and hands-on experience with piano, violin, guitar, and recorder.

MUSIC PROGRAMS for students of all ages

SUZUKI PIANO PROGRAM (www.suzukiassociation.org)

MUSIC THEORY/MUSICIANSHIP

PRIVATE LESSONS:

Piano (Suzuki or Traditional)

Piano Improvisation

Piano/Keyboard in Worship

Voice (Vocal Coaching)

CURRICULUM FOR HOME-SCHOOLED STUDENTS

all programs listed above PLUS

PERFORMING ENSEMBLES

Choral Ensemble * Instrumental Ensemble

and Music Classes for grades Pre-K through Grade 12

2017-2018 TUITION

of $30 to tuition total

New, first-time students may register at any time during a given semester. Tuition is prorated.

Tiamoyo Music Academy lessons are divided into 3 Semesters:

Semester 1 = FALL: August - January

Semester 2 = SPRING: January - June

Semester 3 = SUMMER: June - July

SUZUKI PIANO PROGRAM/PRIVATE LESSON TUITION

30 minute lesson = $25

45 minute lesson = $37.50

60 minute lesson = $50

$ 450.00 per 18-week semester (30 minute lesson)*

$ 675.00 per 18-week semester (45 minute lesson)*

$ 900.00 per 18-week semester (60 minute lesson)*

*(some semesters have fewer than 18 weeks; tuition will be adjusted)

Please add annual non-refundable registration fee of $30 to tuition total.

New, first-time students may register at any time during a given semester. Tuition is prorated.

PRIVATE LESSONS are available for the following:

SUZUKI PIANO PROGRAM

PIANO (traditional)

PIANO IMPROVISATION

VOCAL COACHING

MUSIC THEORY

MUSIC TIME CLASSES

INFANTS, TODDLERS, and SUZUKI KIDZ

$270.00 per semester ([14-18] 30-minute classes)

(e-mail musicacademy@tiamoyoarts.com for MUSIC TIME CLASSES times)

(e-mail musicacademy@tiamoyoarts.com for home-schooler rates)

To register for lessons/classses, please e-mail musicacademy@tiamoyoarts.com with contact information.

New, first-time students may register at any time during a given semester. Tuition is prorated.

E-mail musicacademy@tiamoyoarts.com to schedule a free preview lesson/class.

Sharon Brown Cheston, Ph.D.

Taught Suzuki and Traditional Piano at Laurel School's Laurel Music Academy, Shaker Heights, OH, 2012-2015

Cleveland Institute of Music Faculty, Suzuki Theory, 2003-2009

Orange Community Education and Recreation/Orange School District/Orange Board of Education, Pepper Pike, Ohio: Early Childhood Music Specialist, Orange Early Childhood Center, 1999-2001.

Experienced music educator; taught at every level from graduate school

through pre-school

Ph.D. in Music Education, Case Western Reserve University (joint program with Cleveland Institute of Music)

Doctoral Dissertation Student of Dr. Cynthia Crump Taggart (Dr. Taggart is a former student of and has co-authored with Dr. Edwin Gordon, one of the leading experts in music aptitudes, music audiation, music learning theory, and music development in infants and young children)

M.Mus. in Music History/Ethnomusicology

Bachelor of Music Education (B.M.E.)

Licensed/Ohio Department of Education, State of Ohio: Music/Special K-12 (expires in 2020)

member of Suzuki Association of the Americas (SAA), National Association for Music Education (NAfME), Ohio Music Education Association (OMEA)

Suzuki Piano Teacher Training: Cleveland Institute of Music with Katherine Monsour (Kiki) Barley

Registered with and member of SAA (Suzuki Association of the Americas)

Suzuki Piano Teacher Workshop with Dr. Ray Landers at the Cleveland Institute of Music

Studied piano with James Tannenbaum at the Cleveland Institute of Music, Dr. Robert Mayerovitch of the Elysian Trio and Piano Pedagogy with Evelyn Gott at Baldwin-Wallace College Conservatory of Music

Studied voice with George Vassos, Elizabeth Unis Chesko and Melvin Hakola

Studied organ with Adeline Huss at the Cleveland Institute of Music

Graduate courses in Music Theory at the Cleveland Institute of Music with Alvaretta West

Training in Suzuki Theory Curriculum and Pedagogy at the Cleveland Institute of Music with Dr. Jennifer Conner (author of CIM Preparatory Division Theory Curriculum and Suzuki Theory Program Head)
